question:
Who among the following
were the founders
of the
Hind
Mazdoor Sabha"
established in 1948?
(a)
B.
Krishna
Pillai,
E.MS.
Namboodiripad
and
K.C.
George
(b)
Jayaprakash Narayan, Deen Dayal
Upadhyay and M.N:
(c)
C.P Ramaswamy Iyer;
K: Kamaraj and
Veeresalingam
Pantulu
(d)
Ashok Mehta, T.S. Ramanujam and G.G. Mehta
Answer: (d) Ashok Mehta, T.S. Ramanujam and G.G. Mehta
choices:
(a)
B.
Krishna
Pillai,
E.MS.
Namboodiripad
and
K.C.
George
(b)
Jayaprakash Narayan, Deen Dayal
Upadhyay and M.N:
(c)
C.P Ramaswamy Iyer;
K: Kamaraj and
Veeresalingam
Pantulu
(d)
Ashok Mehta, T.S. Ramanujam and G.G. Mehta
answer: (d) Ashok Mehta, T.S. Ramanujam and G.G. Mehta

question:
Who among the following was not a woman labour leader who
organised workers in the strikes in the 1920s?
a) Sarala Devi Chaudhurani
b)Ushabai Dange
c) Prabhabati Devi
d)Anasuya Behn
Answer: (a) Sarala Devi Chaudhurani
Roy
choices:
a) Sarala Devi Chaudhurani
b)Ushabai Dange
c) Prabhabati Devi
d)Anasuya Behn

question:
Who among the following created the first Al India Trade Union
Congress in 1920?
a) B. P Wadia
b)S. A. Dange
c) N: M. Joshi
d)B. T. Ranadive
Answer: (c) N. M. Joshi
choices:
a) B. P Wadia
b)S. A. Dange
c) N: M. Joshi
d)B. T. Ranadive

question:
Which one among the following was India's first trade union in
the proper sense of the term?
a) Bombay Labour Union
b)Ahmedabad Labour Union
c) Madras Labour Union
d)Allahabad Labour Union
Answer: (c) Madras Labour Union
choices:
a) Bombay Labour Union
b)Ahmedabad Labour Union
c) Madras Labour Union
d)Allahabad Labour Union

question:
Consider the following statements:
1. The Factories Act, 1881
was passed with
a view to fix the
wages of industrial
workers and
to allow the
workers to
form trade unions.
2.N.M.
Lokhande
was
a
pioneer in
organising the labour
movement in
British India.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a)
1
only
(b)
2 only
Both 1 and 2
(d)
Neither 1 nor 2
Answer: (b) 2 only
choices:
(a)
1
only
(b)
2 only
Both 1 and 2
(d)
Neither 1 nor 2
